Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with immigration requirements
Legal_Issue: Did the immigration officer violate the duty of fairness by demonstrating bias during the applicant's humanitarian and compassionate grounds interview?
Evidence_Assessment: Interview lasted nearly an hour, eliciting substantial new information beyond the file contents
Legal_Rule: Judicial review requires showing reversible error, not a retrial. The court cannot substitute its opinion for the officer’s discretion unless legal error exists.
Outcome_on_Merits: No likelihood or actual bias was found; officer acted fairly and within discretion
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No bias or unfairness found; process was fair
Key_Evidence_Considered: Content of interview, file review, applicant's statements
Legal_Framework: Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) grounds under immigration law
Applicant_Challenge: Bias and unfairness in decision-making process
Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, documentary evidence from file
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of decision denying permanent residence
Legal_Provision: s. 18 of the Federal Court Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 18 of the Federal Court Act
Governing_Rule: Duty of fairness in administrative decision-making

Legal_Issue: Did the immigration officer act with bias or lack fairness in denying the applicant's request for permanent residence based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds?
Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visa; refugee claim rejected; applied for permanent residence on humanitarian grounds
Court_Ruling: No evidence of bias or unfairness; officer acted fairly and with open mind
Claimant_Status: Former temporary resident, failed refugee claimant
Defendant_Behavior: Reviewed file, conducted nearly one-hour interview, asked if there was anything new
Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations due to personal circumstances
Assessment_Factor: Length and substance of interview, openness of decision-maker
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (implied), Federal Court Act
Procedural_Issue: Alleged procedural unfairness in H&C interview
Evidence_Used: Interview content, written application, file materials
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 18 of the Federal Court Act
Evidence_Assessed: Substantial new information provided during interview
Governing_Rule: Duty of fairness in administrative proceedings
Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed visa and sought permanent residence after rejection of refugee claim
Evidence_Handling: Officer reviewed file but still engaged in detailed interview
Legal_Provision_Violated: Immigration status violation due to overstay
Legal_Provision: s. 18 of the Federal Court Act
Evidence_Assessment: New information provided during interview demonstrated fairness
Decision_Rationale: No bias shown; officer exercised discretion appropriately
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reversible error standard in judicial review
